website_summaries.verdict: Compact and extremely lightweight, this little stick vac is a great option for cleaning small messes or reaching tight spots.
pros: At only 4 pounds, this is the lightest of the Dirt Devil stick vacuum models, which makes it easy to carry around to every room in the house
The detachable crevice tool is perfect for cleaning window sills or getting into tight spots where other vacuums can't go
The vacuum requires no more storage space than a broom
cons: The 1.25 amp motor will run hot with prolonged usage, so this model is not ideal for large rooms or big jobs

website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option that's useful in smaller areas.
pros: One of the lightest electric brooms on the market
Highly versatile design quickly adapts from stick vacuum to dust buster
Comes with an attachable wand for detail cleaning
It really shines for its ability to pick up pet hair on bare floors

website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive ultra-lightweight vacuum that doubles as a handheld vac. A versatile option that's easy to store.
pros: Detachable handheld vac with a crevice tool for the smallest spills
At only 4.5 lb., it's lightweight and portable
Powerful suction can clean up pet hair
cons: It lacks durability and construction quality

customer_reviews.title: FILTER ISSUE. The vacuum uses filter F113 (see the ...
customer_reviews.text: FILTER ISSUE. The vacuum uses filter F113 (see the picture "REPLACEMENT FILTER F113"). The only problem: filter F113 doesn't exist. So, in the manual and on the website Dirt Devil suggests to use filter F25 instead (which obviously doesn't fit this vacuum). Since the manufacturer does not respond to inquiries, I'm returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: orlick

customer_reviews.title: WIN! WIN!
customer_reviews.text: This was probably the most awesome Christmas gift I could have ever given my 4 year old. She wanted a vacuum like mommy's. I looked at all of the toy vacuums and some how came across this beauty. The toy vacuums cost more and did less than this little dirt devil. It is the perfect height and weight for her. Instead of pretending to vacuum, she actually is vacuuming. WIN! WIN!
customer_reviews.author: SneauxDayz

customer_reviews.title: The first week of August the vacuum started acting like there was something wrong with the switch
customer_reviews.text: The first week of August the vacuum started acting like there was something wrong with the switch. It was never used more that once a week so it couldn't be from overuse. For the next three weeks it would start, then stop, then start again, etc. Finally on August 28 it would not start at all. I ordered it because of the corded hand-held part with the thin nozzle. When it worked correctly, it was fine. It was inexpensive and very light but still it should have worked a lot longer than a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for , but it's not worth buying unless you plan to never have to use it . I've bought at least 5 dirt devil vaccums in the last 3 years and to be honest with you I will never waste money on the brand again. The suction on them starts out very good but after a few weeks they seem to give up on cleaning the carpets proper . At least two of them had parts break in the first few weeks . It's not like I vaccume every day for 2-3 hours but maybe once or twice a week anyway they are not built or made to last very long
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk. Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: To say this thing is a piece of sh** is a dramatic understatement. I was excited to get it for light cleaning in a 23 ft travel trailer. It wouldn't even pick up a piece of potato chip that was the size of a pencil eraser even after numerous passes. This "vacuum" sucks and not in the way it is supposed to. Do not buy. The only thing I think this might be useful for is to give to a little kid so they can "help" around the house, but you will definitely have to go back over every thing they did with a real vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: D B

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste a penny on this version
customer_reviews.text: Had our first simplistik for two years and it was amazing. Cheap yet powerful and skinny enough to store in a small apartment. This new version we just got a month ago and it barely picks up anything. I ran my hand along the bottom with it on and it felt like a gentle blow of someone’s breath and not like a vaccum with sucking power at all. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: L. White

customer_reviews.title: Mostly not happy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: it gets the job done. Cons: the smell of dust + motor goes in your face when using it. Thanks to the design dirt devil made by putting the “exhaust” facing the user. The older model didn’t have this beautiful feature, but to my surprise, they changed the design. Maybe to let the customer feel like one with the vacuum....to really know how it feels like being a dirt devil.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this one and it's such a cheap piece of crap. Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was an avid dirt devil vacuum owner for years. After 5 years my last one sadly bit it. I ordered this one and it's such a cheap piece of crap. Not sturdy, cheap plastic and stopped working a month later. Now this one is going to the trash as well....So sad
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Furious!
customer_reviews.text: FURIOUS! Thanks Amazon! I marked this item was a gift and it arrived today in the actual box no vacuum in a amazon box like the other 200 orders I’ve placed this year. First of all it’s Christmas season and leaving a vacuum cleaner in its original box showing what it is on my front porch isn’t very smart. Second of all when I mark it’s a gift and it arrives in the original box not in an Amazon box, I’m beyond frustrated. Returning and will not reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Momof4

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Got this literally a month ago (August 26) and loved it at first because of how small and lightweight it was. I've used it less than 10 times and is no longer working. I could be going over an area where there are obvious crumbs and it just pushes it around. I've tried putting my hand against the suction part and could barely feel anything which explains why it's not cleaning anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Kang

customer_reviews.title: New model, crappy brittle plastic
customer_reviews.text: The older version of this product was a quality item, used it for years without issue and only bought another one because I had left it behind for a friend in the move. This item broke after 2 weeks with minimal use. The plastic latch which is used to empty the dirt from the simplistik broke with the second time that I opened it with routine mild-moderate pressure applied. I miss the old version this new one is crap. Also the new attachment for the extender that allows for reach has a cheap attachment to the device handle (for when you are not using it) that falls off with regular routine vacuuming on hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Vixen JP

customer_reviews.title: Broken within a month of being used
customer_reviews.text: Previous version was much better. This one is way cheaper. The filter is 3 times smaller. The on-board crevice tool falls off all the time, very poor connection to the stick. When vacuuming let's say under the table when it's under the angle, brush doesn't touch the floor and of course can't catch any dirt. It lasted only 1 month and a little piece of plastic , wich is supposed to hold two parts together, got broken. No wonder it's so small and thin! Well, the only valuable part of this vacuum is a metal stick. The rest is just cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Olena

customer_reviews.title: Run the Other Way!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this piece of you know what. It is absolutely worthless. I made the mistake of buying three of them so can say for absolute certain they are garbage. Cord is too short, no suction, lightweight plastic. It is more like a kids toy than a real appliance. Shame on Amazon and Dirt Devil for even trying to push this POS off on their customers.
customer_reviews.author: mljenson

customer_reviews.title: Dirty mess
customer_reviews.text: This is useless. I had high hopes for this device as an alternative to dragging out the vacuum for quick pick-me-ups around the house. But, it has poor suction, so you have to run over an area repeatedly to see a difference.Of course, it is small and the dirt-catcher fills quickly, so even a small job requires emptying the dirt-catcher several times, which is a dusty mess. Frankly, it's easier to pull out the vacuum. Even, a broom is more effective, quicker and CLEANER than the Simple-Stik.
customer_reviews.author: Huck's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Does not pickup!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my area rug and wood floors. I was very disappointed in this stickvac. I just needed pickup for an area rug and cat hair on my wood floors. The suction was practically non existent; it doesn't even pick up the dust from the wood floors, much less on the area rug. I always liked the Dirt Devil, all the others that I have tried have been pretty powerful, easily handling my carpets and floors. This one does not perform as advertised. I will not purchase this again and will be wary of trying another Dirt Devil.
customer_reviews.author: PHX LIONESS

customer_reviews.title: Utterly useless.
customer_reviews.text: This pitiful vacuum struggles to pick up anything at all, and, to make matters even less convenient, it has a tendency to overheat quickly and "die." Sure, I can plug the thing back in after a rest period, but if I'm going to be working with such an inefficient tool to begin with, I'd at least like it to run for more than three minutes at a time. I'll be purchasing a more expensive vacuum in the near future, as this disappointment's left me no other choice.
customer_reviews.author: Launcher Spider

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $20
customer_reviews.text: Although this only costs $20, you should probably just save your money. I bought this to use on the tile floors in my bathrooms. Since the time of my purchase, I have probably used it a total of ten times. Today, when I tried to turn it on, it did not start. I have not been able to figure out what is wrong, and will have to throw it away. I do not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: EKG

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, but it doesn’t have great suction at all. I bought this to vacuum a 3’3” x 4’9” in my classroom. The rug is not used in a high traffic area, but this vacuum doesn’t even vacuum the entire rug before needing to empty it’s miniscule reservoir! I should’ve spent a little more money and bought a real vacuum! A carpet sweep would work better than this has...total waste of $20!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum attachments are not standard
customer_reviews.text: I like these little vacuums. This is the second simpli-stik I've purchased. However, I was disappointed with this recent purchase for two reasons. First, they changed the design of the hose attachment ends. If you zoom in closely to their photos, you can see that the attachment ends are not round, they're rectangle in shape. This is a bummer because I want to put other attachment ends on the vacuum; which are round. Second, they changed the filter pod. It's much smaller and has an over-housing that restricts air flow; so it plugs up much sooner than the older design. Otherwise, it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clip will break holding unit together
customer_reviews.text: I have had three of these same exact units. There is a small clip that holds the top and bottom half together. You need to use this clip each time you empty the canister. The clip is so cheaply made that it will inevitably break. My first unit worked for years then the unit fell and the clip broke. I can live with that as for the price and the number of years I got use of it, it was fine. The second units clip broke within six months. and this unit I just bought, the clip broke within two days. Lightweight with good suction power but cheaply made...at least the clip.
customer_reviews.author: yanks023

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum worked well for about a month. Then it just stopped picking anything up. We always emptied the catch after ever use. When it started having issues we tried everything that we could. We snaked any dog hair out of the uptake and washed the filter (yes, dried it completely before putting it back in). No matter what we've done it won't pick up ANYTHING anymore. Useless waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: You get what you'd expect for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this vacuum cleaner for 5 years. It does the job if you're living in a college dorm room and you aren't very messy and don't have much surface area to clean up. You do have to go over certain areas repeatedly in order to suck up things like hair or pieces of string that maybe be stuck in the carpet. The filter gets dirty fairly quickly and you will have to dump the dust out in the middle of vacuuming if your room is larger than a college dorm room. However, the crevice tool has much better suction and seems to be much more efficient. It is lightweight and easy to store almost anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Just suction, not for carpet, pet hair or hair.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know it doesn’t have a brush roll, just a poor suction, strong noise but nah .. works a little better on hardwood floor and nothing else, it does pick up some pet hair but a lot is left behind, also I’d doesn’t work if you have any woman roomate that their hair are all over the floor.. also it doesn’t even try on carpet at all, you’ll waste your time, but ok for light cleaning if your house are really clean already, no kids, no animals and no hair, buy the one with brush roll, I bought that one too, it was $24 now it’s $34 it least just 1 year and the brush will stop roll.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Do It
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. I carefully read many reviews before buying and eventually decided to do it. Right out of the box I could tell how cheap the plastic frame is. I've had stick vacuums before, however this was the cheapest quality one I've encountered. Gave it a chance though, can't judge a book by its cover... Suction was not great AT ALL. I had to take the head/wheel component off in order to get a mediocre suction. Unless you are pressing down very, I mean VERY firmly on the vacuum to the floor surfice, suction isn't going to clean anything! Very disappointed... not sure, can you return a used vacuum?!
customer_reviews.author: kristen farrell

customer_reviews.title: Might want to look elsewhere for a stick vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Simply put: it is good for what it’s meant for...hard floors. Tiles, laminates, and woods are friends for this vacuum. However, any kind of area rug or carpets (low or high pile) and mats are simply too much for this. It will not pick up basic lint or debris on anything remotely fabric. Making it useless for multifloor spaces. The build of this vacuum is sub par. It feels like a toy. The plastic handle also keeps unclicking and detaching from the pole. This is an annoyance. I also feel the suction has depleted since it’s purchase. Not meant for long lasting use.
customer_reviews.author: Leo L.

customer_reviews.title: Not Really for Carpets: Beware of USED Amazon Warehouse Deals
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Warehouse(USED) purchase with disappointing results. When I received it, I was ecstatic, then I tried to put it together and saw lots of dust and scratches inside and outside. I liked it for the money but not worth it for carpet. It does not really do carpet well from what I seen but beware when buying used as previous owners may have used it poorly. The vac handle(red top handle) needs to be put together around the grey handle. Previous user who returned it to Amazon put the red handles together before which is wrong. It seems to only way to fix the red handles and put it on correctly might result in breakage. DO NOT BUY USED.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, am serious, you'll regret it..
customer_reviews.text: From 1-10 this has 1or 2 suction power. Can't believe the good reviews. I took time today to rate my amazon purchases and from 13 thing this is the only one not getting 4 & 5 🌟 s. Plus I got insurance cause it was really cheap, I never got it and acording to amazon it was delivered before the vacuum. I never returned it to avoid hassle but it's just sitting in my garage, it never suction just tiny stuff like Styrofoam particles. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: good vacuum cleaner if you have pets
customer_reviews.text: One thing that I liked is that this vacuum cleaner is easy to assemble. In addition, I live in a small apartment so the fact that is pretty small is very convenient for me since I can easily fit it in the laundry room. Also, I have a small dog so one important thing for me was to buy a vacuum cleaner that could easily remove all the hair from the floor and this machine definitely does that very well! when I empty it, it is full of dogs hair. It definitely cleans well in hard floor but, in my opinion, it could do a bit better in carpet. Besides that, it was a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Llamas

customer_reviews.title: Best Vacuum Ever?
customer_reviews.text: I bought a $60 standard vacuum when I moved into my first place. It wasn't a quarter of a good as this little guy, and it took up WAY more space. This vacuum is amazing. It's light and easy to store and carry, it has suction like you wouldn't believe, and it's so much easier than a big vacuum with a bunch of attachments you'll never use. I loved it so much I bought another for my cousin when he moved out to his first place. I'm debating buying another one for my sister. I'm so impressed that something so cheap and small can handle such big jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is such a waste of money. I didn't read the reviews because it was recommended by Buzzfeed. That was my first mistake. The thing was easy to put together, and that is where the positives end. It doesn't pick up anything. It is screechy loud. If I have to vacuum, you can bet I expect the darn thing to do its part. I could literally do better with a broom made of cooked spaghetti. Save your pennies and buy something decent. This is a complete waste.
customer_reviews.author: Lavarocks

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy this to clean my house with, but I like it okay. It is basically a handheld little vacuum on a stick. I bought it to clean an area for cats that gets a lot of cat litter around it. This thing vacuums up the cat litter. May not last forever, but since it is going to get covered in used cat litter and was $20, I'm not so worried about that as I will get another one. I will say that when you detach it to empty the container, it is a little hard to pop back on. Still, I'll buy again if I need to, though I think that will be some time from now.
customer_reviews.author: historyglobe

customer_reviews.title: For the price, its great!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I love this little lightweight thing! I'm zipping all over the house picking stuff up. It definitely doesnt clean as deep as a full vacuum with a rotating brush on the bottom, but with this sweet little number I'm ducking up cobwebs, spiders, debris on windowsills, pet hair, and any dirty my farmer boyfriend tracks in, so I'm pretty content. If you're looking for something to deep clean with, its not for you. But if you're looking for something to do your lightweight daily pick up, this is the product you want
customer_reviews.author: Qwerty

customer_reviews.title: I have 2 dogs and a cat
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work!! I read all these good reviews and had high hopes but I guess that's just online shopping for ya. It seriously does not pick anything up, not on carpet, hardwood floors, nothing. Don't waste your money like I did! It comes in pieces that you fit together and you have the option to use the flat floor sweeper thing and it doesn't work with or without. It doesn't hold very much, its just a cheap piece of plastic with a motor! Vacuums are just one of those things you have to splurge on to really get the good product you want.
customer_reviews.author: Cameo

customer_reviews.title: Works Alright
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say that it's the best option. One of the big issues is that when you are trying to suck anything in, it will most likely get stuck on the front of he nozzle, instead of the latch getting pushed open by what's being sucked in. You might want to use a pencil or something to force it open as stuff collects on the outside, which is what I have to do A couple other minor things I don' like about it would be how you open it to release the junk and how hard it is to re-align the case when you pull it out to throw out the junk.
customer_reviews.author: EliteReviewsUSA

customer_reviews.title: Easily tips and latch is cheap
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality was very disappointing as the little latch that connects and holds the top and bottom piece snapped off after a few uses, leaving the vacuum unusable. The vacuum is also awkwardly balanced, more heavy in the front, causing it to tip VERY easily (pretty much anytime you have it standing without leaning against something). I feel like if I had reached out to the company in a timely manner they would have taken care of this, but instead I stuffed it in the closet and went back to my trusty old vacuum that we’ve had for over a decade!
customer_reviews.author: EHot

customer_reviews.title: Design needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this vacuum I was very excited about it. My daughter loved it so much I even bought her one for Christmas. They worked really well and didn't take up much space. The fact that it's light weight makes it easy for her to carry up and down stairs. Unfortunately, BOTH vacuums ended up breaking in the same spot. The little latch that holds the vacuum together needs to be redesigned. It's way too flimsy and breaks very easily. If it weren't for that one piece, I think this would be a great vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Monica O.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Great little unit. But no one have F113 filter for this unit or can tell you if they ever will. So when the filter that came with the unit wear out, you can just throw it away. Had battery pack units before this unit. they would last about three month. wouldn't hold a charge. I got it replaced, replacement did the same thing. Not counting the $30 to ship it back to Dirt Devil. There will no more Dirt Devil for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Seever

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: I am not impressed at all with this vacum. It definetely has low suction. It was missing the notch that held the cable too. The cable was so small I had to plug it wherever I went. It is a total waste of money. I didn't even bother to waste my time to return it because gas would have cost me more to go to the post office and return it. Needless to say it's garbage. I found a $6 old school dirt devil at a Goodwill that I am loving 100%. So that is my honest review . I can't sit here and pretend this ia good when it really sucks !!!
customer_reviews.author: Love4jewelry

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say but this is a very flimsy vacuum cleaner. It looks and feels like a toy. I purchased it to clean the rug under my kitchen table, since it needs cleaning almost everyday I wanted something lightweight and readily available. This was not the answer for my issue. I gave it to my 8 year old granddaughter for the rug in her bedroom, she is very happy to have her own vacuum cleaner that works. I am glad it works for her since it didn't work for me. I did find a shark vacuum on sale after Christmas to take care of my rug. Now everyone is happy!
customer_reviews.author: Debbi Dee

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: Love that this is small and has an attachment for small crevices but that’s about it. We had an older version of this vacuum that worked great but sadly that one eventually died. This one barely works, I can run it over the same piece of dirt over and over and it still doesn’t suck it up. The actual hold for sucking is less than two inches long and you have to position the vacuum so that the hole goes exactly over it to even have a chance of getting the dirt and even then it barely works. There is 0 suction power. This was such a waste of money, don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: JmV2356

customer_reviews.title: The best $20 you will ever spend!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was amazingly surprised by the performance of the vacuum for the money. It is really a great all-around vacuum for day to day cleaning. It may not have the suction power or fancy styling of a Dyson, but it cost less than the shipping of a "fancy" vacuum. I also like the module design, which makes it very versatile. It can go from a 'dust-buster' to a handheld vacuum in seconds and performs excellently in both applications. We have used the vacuum almost daily for 2 months and are still impressed with its performance. I would say that this is one of the rare instances where you get more than you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Taj

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Unit works great for what it is intended. So why one star? Because the latch that holds the dustbin to the motor unit breaks very easily. I’m on my second unit since October 10, 2019. On both units the latch broke with very little use. I thought the first one was my mistake until it happened the second time. Since it’s to late to return to Amazon and the manufacturer will only replace not refund I’ll make them keep replacing them until the one year warranty is up. If they want to make it painful for me I’ll return the favor.
customer_reviews.author: fasedy

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap AF and low-key jank but it works
customer_reviews.text: It's a vacuum under a hundred bucks. You get what you pay for. It works (barely) for my tiny apartment. Oftentimes, it won't even pick up half an old gum wrapper, because the suction power isn't great. The hack there is to just attach the long nozzle and use it all the time, so that it focuses the suction and makes it slightly stronger. I've only used it on carpeting but, I mean, if you're just moving out then this is better than nothing but it really isn't ideal
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price! Works GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: *Can't beat it for the price! Works GREAT!! [actually amazingly efficient] *Excellent suction for being so very lightweight. *Four -way choices provide pickup options: floor roller, stick, On-Board Crevice Tool and handheld vac. *Floor roller easily reaches under most cabinets' indentation. *Can work long time without emptying washable filter. *I recently had cricket invasion (thousands!) in home. This Dirt Devil powerfully sucked 'em up dead or alive! -Wish for (a) longer cord, (b) colored (or labeled) ON/OFF control. (It's the middle one, not top one), (c) make floor roller easier-to-remove .
customer_reviews.author: AFA_Prof

customer_reviews.title: but it’s a nifty light weight vacuum and it works just fine on hard floors
customer_reviews.text: It works! OK, first of all it’s a vacuum for under $20. Yes the plastic is cheap and there is no rotary brush, but it’s a nifty light weight vacuum and it works just fine on hard floors. It cleans up crumps, dirt & dog hair from our floor just fine. And, did I mention this bad boy is under 20 bucks? It’s perfect for college students or anyone that wants an inexpensive alternative to a broom. Yes, it is cheap & kind of reminds me of a kids toy, but that just makes me chuckle every time I pull it out to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: rhhb

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This stick vac is great. First of all you are purchasing a dustbuster on a stick, this is not for major cleaning and can't be run for a crazy extended period at a time. With that being said I got this because my son loves to help me clean and my shark vacuum is too heavy for him. He's only six. He was able to vacuum several rooms including the kitchen with no issues and did a pretty good job. The vacuum ran for like 30 minutes. It's light weight and great for a quick clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as an earlier version
customer_reviews.text: We have an older version of this, which works quite well. Bought this one as a Christmas gift for my mother thinking it was the same, but it's not. She has trouble even turning it on due to the way the on-off button is indented and somewhat difficult to slide. I tried it out, and it doesn't even pick up as well as the older version. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerlily

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because this thing is dirt cheap. But I love it! It feels cheaply made (but hello, it was $16. lol) But I bought it for vacuuming my hardwood floors, and it works perfectly. Also great for stairs in either stick or handheld mode. Easy to empty, and extremely lightweight. Almost feels like a toy (which means my kids also love using it--score!). I do wish the cord was a little longer though, which is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: HappyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. I hate sweeping. I have white marble tile type floors and when I sweep, the dust just blows back and forth. This has honestly changed my life. I also have a small area rug that I like to keep clean and this thing sucks so hard that I am noticing some of the strings being pulled up. I don’t mind because I plan on buying another rug in the near future, I care more about it being clean while I have it. All in all, this vacuum is amazing, I hope I have it forever and ever.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy! Zero suction
customer_reviews.text: If you bought this for $1 it would be 99 cents too much. We had a good laugh trying to use this on a 10x10 office. You literally have to pick up pieces and feed them into the end. It's too late to return this so into the trash it went - after only three uses. I would have donated this 'vacuum' to somebody, but it'd have to be someday that I hated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum for cleaning up after my toddler!! I didn't want food going in my good vacuum! Also just wanted a cheap vacuum the if it broke or got gross from toddler messes, then it would be easy to replace! This does the job! I use it on short carpet and linoleum, and don't have any issues. Every now and then I do take the filer out and just wash it off with some hot water and let it air dry!! Then the suction comes back like it was brand new!! I have had this vacuum for almost 2 years now maybe more!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Tried and true for years, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Dirt Devil stick vac about 18 years ago, it works for years and never failed. So I decided to get another one for another, the design for the grip and stick changed a little, and somehow it has more suction than the one I had before. The price difference is $5. I paid $20 18 years ago at Walmart, now it's $25. The best value on stick vacs.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't get the job done
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this vacuum a long time. I pair it with a broom and my Swiffer, and I just... don't like it. And so I'm resentfully looking at vacuums that cost hundreds, because I just want one that can get the job done WELL. I have vinyl tile floors and some rugs. This vacuum putters around and bumps over dust/dirt I've collected, but doesn't grab it. I'll go over the same area 3, 4, 5 times and it'll still be there. I try to use the hand-vac instead but then I'm hunched over and, it's just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this not expecting very much. I have had hand vacuums in the past and their main feature was really weak suction. This unit actually had some power and could lift things up. Even with the floor attachment on it there was enough power to pick stuff up off the carpet. The only down side is that with the handle attached you have to reach way down to operate the power switch. Having a switch up by the handle would be great but would increase the price quite a bit. I do not know how long this will last but for $20 it cannot be beat. It even comes with a nozzle for use on furniture. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Rune

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this stick!
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this stick, a lot. My old Black and Decker wore out and I bought a DD because of the brand. It's suction is low, you have to clean the filter frequently, the cord is short, and it doesn't swivel. The filter is hard to clean, it has a flimsy material which won't last long. I went on DD web site to order more filters, they only had one available and I had to pay for shipping. I did look in stores for the filter and couldn't find them there either.
customer_reviews.author: Mason, OH

customer_reviews.title: just fine. I didnt have huge expectations
customer_reviews.text: Small vac for quick messes, suited my purpose (extra vacuum in the laundry room and basement area), just fine. I didnt have huge expectations, it didnt pick up leaves tracked into the house well this fall season. I didnt have an issue with anything else though. It works similar to a hand held dust buster, only you dont have to bend over because its an upright vac and you can plug it in (no need to worry about the battery running out like in similar vacs). I liked it, especially for the price and what i use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jme D

customer_reviews.title: My Mistake
customer_reviews.text: My mistake: I had a Dirt Devil VIBE for years - the best little gadget in the house, never let me down, but finally the stick broke - so I needed a replacement. Unfortunately I did not pay attention to the significant difference when I bought the Simply-Stick. This stick is pathetic in comparison, it has no option toggle for carpet/bare floors, was more complex to put together and altogether does not do a great job. Incidentally, I received a package that had obviously been opened and handled before....
customer_reviews.author: Petra K

customer_reviews.title: Don't let this vacuum to be knocked down because it's going to be gone, gone !!!!
customer_reviews.text: To tell you the truth I really liked the performance and the price. But my husband accidentally knocked it down, it fell and when I tried put back up, the LITTLE part that holds the top and the bottom together was broken and that was the end of it. No more vacuum. I have bought THREE of them, one for my house, one for my friend and one for my office. My friend's and mine are GONE for the same reason. Looked to see if I could replace the broken part, but they do not sell it. I AM SO DISSAPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. Worst amazon purchase I’ve ever made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a similar style about 6 years ago and loved it. It sucked up every piece of hair, dirt, food, etc. Unfortunately, the motor burnt up but I only spent $20 and had it 6 years so I still considered it a great buy. This was the closest I could find and seemed to be advertised as the “updated” version. I have never been so disappointed. I have 2 dogs and 2 cats with 1,200 sq ft of walnut stained hardwood floors so I need something that could be used daily and match up to the amount of shedding my golden retriever does. This is not it! It’s awful. Zero suction and the latch system is extremely weak.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Can’t handle dog hair
customer_reviews.text: I originally liked this for our house, which is mostly hardwood flooring. It picked up the dirt and the cat shedding. But then I got a yellow lab and really needed to pick up all the hair. It was apparently too much for this vacuum. It gets clogged up at the front and fills up way too quickly. I need something that cleans up more forcefully and doesn’t leave hairs behind. There’s nothing really wrong with it, it’s just not a good fit for dirtier floors.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Decent deal if you don't have to vacuum up cat litter a lot.
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay purchase if you can deal with a few little things. The roller extension (the wide piece on the ground) was difficult to get in and off. I felt like I was going to break it almost every time but the first. It seemed to have great suction, but eventually--even though there was barely anything in the bin--there would be a bunch of stuff in the mouth of the thing that wouldn't get sucked up and would just fall all over the ground when turned off. I have a relatively messy cat, so I was just spreading cat litter all over my floor because of it. That's when I decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Warner

customer_reviews.title: Overall convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Works as well as my Black & Decker dustbuster. It's nice that it's on a long handle. I use it just for getting seeds and feathers up off the carpet around my bird cage. Very convenient and stores easily. The hook for the cord doesn't swivel so you do have to unhook the whole cord by hand. The cord is not super long, but long enough for the small job that I do with it. I really like it and use it on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: mollyann

customer_reviews.title: What used to be a great vacuum is now HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 5 years ago, it lasted a very long time and was used regularly. Never had any issue with it. The latest one I bought overheats after two minutes -- piping hot. This was the second one after I sent the first back. Same issue. The build is also cheaper. I would never use another one of these, even if someone gave it to me for free.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Sterns

customer_reviews.title: Good for hard floors
customer_reviews.text: We have had this vacuum for 3 years now. It works well on hard surfaces, but not well on carpets. The suction power isn’t anything to write home about, but it works well for our small apartment. I probably wouldn’t recommend it if you have a large space, but for smaller ones it does the job just fine. Also it is very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: This Vacuum Is Great---for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. No, it is NOT a regular vacuum, but it doesn't cost very much, either. Mine definitely is perfect for small jobs and for cleaning the stairs fairly well (it is so light weight it makes cleaning stairs easy!). It's fun to use and functional enough. Just don't expect it to be the equivalent of a regular vacuum cleaner. Now and then I need to get the big vacuum out but this one works in-between just great! Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Like it so much that I'm going to give a few as gifts
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for 4 months now, and it's still going strong. It picks up a LOT, with little effort, and beats dragging the big vacuum around for small messes and daily sweeping up. It will not deep-clean carpet, but it will pick up off the surface, and I found it's really great for throw / bath rugs, as it isn't strong enough to lift them up and have them get stuck in the suction, but strong enough to give them enough of a clean until the next time they are thrown in the washer. Overall, I am extremely pleased, and actually came back to this page to buy a few more for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Embarrassingly weak for AC powered vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I have a handheld dirt from the 90's and it has great power. This is very extremely wimpy and has less pull than the average battery powered unit. I only use it for edging with the narrow tube and it's barely up to that job. I would have gladly done without the attachments if they'd just put a better motor in it. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Goebbels Gerbils

customer_reviews.title: This little gadget sucks up all the fur from carpet and rugs around ...
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning up after cats and my bf has never been easier. I have a cordless handheld vacuum for quick clean ups but the suction is not powerful enough to pick up pet hair. This little gadget sucks up all the fur from carpet and rugs around the apartment without me having to take out my big vacuum which is super heavy and inconvenient to do on a daily basis. If you're looking for a vacuum to perform quick daily cleanups, then this item is for you.
customer_reviews.author: quratolain a.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, it literally looks and feels like the toy vacuum cleaners you buy for kids. I know it was only $20 but for $10-15 more, you could order a WAY better quality one from a Walmart. I should've just did that. I usually don't give bad reviews but this one I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very "you get what you pay for" product, where it gets the job done but ultimately will leave behind harder to pick-up items like hair and solid food items- I accidentally dropped some M&Ms and the vacuum was no match. For the purpose of quick clean up in a small space, however, it accomplishes the goal.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I live in 3 bhk and hv one 3 years old boy. I never used vaccumm cleaner bf. Always used broom and stuff. But lately back is giving so much trouble. So wanted something light. Found this. Very cheap, good work, very light, picks up everything from rooms and kitchen. I also used it in bathrooms (2 bathrooms). I read comments earlier so was little doubtful. I noticed vaccumms suction mouth is small so you need to take it exactly over the garbage like paper pieces etc and move it slowly. It took me around 30 minutes to vaccumm 3 rooms, living room, kitchen and bathrooms. I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charu

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for 3 years and loved it. Finally a wire must have broke in the cord. I ordered this. What a disappointment. It barely picks up anything. There was a piece of green fuzz on the floor I had to go over about 10 times to finally pick it up. I would return it but my husband discarded to box. The small tool for cracks and crevices does not even stay on. Not happy about this at all.
customer_reviews.author: PattiS

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was raggedy
customer_reviews.text: Idk how to feel about it...... of course it’s cheap and eventually it will pick up dirt after running it over the same spot 7 times.... that packaging blew me.... the box was raggedy and it was only shipped in the actual dirt devil box.... that’s ghetto, so that’s why I give 2 stars.....if it was shipped better, maybe 4 stars, it’s good for the price
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Obviously don't expect performance of a 1000 watt vacuum. For light and normal jobs it's perfect. easy to assemble, surprisngly powerful, no belts to worry about. cheaper to buy this than the belt to fix my old vaccum i didnt like as much. Don't knock it because it can't make quick work of a whole beach trip worth of sand.
customer_reviews.author: ( ﾟ▽ﾟ)

customer_reviews.title: It sucks!  It really sucks!
customer_reviews.text: This little devil really sucks! I was pleasantly surprised by how much it actually sucks. It came in 6 parts and had to be assembled. Assembly was a snap....literally. The only thing that could make this better is if the handheld removed easier from the floor attachment. Worth every bit of the $20 I paid....so far. Will try to update after we have used it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review
customer_reviews.text: I was using it once a week, everything was great and now after eight months of usage the small part that holds the duster to the handle is broken and the two main parts of the machine can't be held together. This goes in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Fancy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dog Fur
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool and especially for the low price. I have used others with a battery that always wore out and could not do my whole floor. Since this has a plug in, it is wonderful. I have a bad back so this is light as a feather. I have a Golden Retriever who sheds a lot and this pics up all his fur with ease. You can also take it apart and there is a hand vac option. It will even do a very light once over on carpet but is mainly for hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Dream

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum for the Money!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this vacuum! It's great for quick clean ups or regular vacuuming. I do not have carpet. I really like that it comes apart and I can vacuum my stairs without it being so big. It gets up hair & dust great! For the price i don't think it could be any better!! Would definitely buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be more satisfied with this $20 vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more satisfied with this $20 vacuum! It's perfect for dorm room cleaning(long enough cord to cover a one bedroom suite). I doubted the product when I first saw some comments complained about the suction power. But when I started using it, I found the power of this vacuum is incredibly strong (for my hardwood floor) and it can easily get rid of almost every spottable objects on the floor. I seriously doubt anyone can find a better price point for a machine that truly works and satisfies the most basic cleaning needs. 10/10 for money well-spent!
customer_reviews.author: kaya

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and efficient
customer_reviews.text: When I had purchased this vacuum cleaner, we were living a one-bedroom apartment with carpet. I was surprised how great it had worked. Now, three years later, we have a two-bedroom place without carpet with a 65-pound dog and a baby. Another bigger vacuum cleaner purchased around the same time has already died but this vacuum cleaner is still able to suck up all the dog hair and anything else fallen on the floor. We are extremely satisfied with this product and would highly recommend it. However, since it is small, be prepared to dump the junk and clean the filter every so often depending on your usage. A small inconvenience for a reliable and efficient product in our opinion.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for hard flooring and area rugs.
customer_reviews.text: What a brilliant solution for those of us with hard floors and a cat! It is super light weight, picks up cat hair, dust bunnies and grit - even dried cat food. Very easy to empty and converts to hand held Dirt Devil quickly. I'm very impressed with this cheap solution to my problem of dust/cat hair collections on laminate flooring. Also does a decent job on area rugs. My only problem with this is the power chord is very short and either needs an extension chord or if you have lots of electrical outlets then frequent plugging and unplugging from outlet to outlet - but for the price that's a small issue.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Pietersen

customer_reviews.title: Great for dorm rooms and other small places!
customer_reviews.text: I was sick of my cordless vacuum. It was way too tiny for me. I got this vacuum since it was the cheapest option with good reviews. I am so glad I did! The box it came in was not too heavy. It arrived on time y dorm It was pretty easy to set up (and I have never put a vacuum together). I was amazed at how much hair and dust it sucked up. It's good for its price. If you live in a dorm or a small apartment, this is a good vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa （＾_＾）

customer_reviews.title: I tend to turn the AC off while I run this because it does draw a good deal of power but I've never actually tripped the ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this in the RV because with the amount of dirt we track in, a battery powered one just would not do. I tend to turn the AC off while I run this because it does draw a good deal of power but I've never actually tripped the breaker when running both. I love this thing!! it comes apart so storing in a small space is easy and is has lots of power. Plenty to keep my RV floors which are mostly linoleum but also there is a tiny bit of carpet under and around the dinette, super clean. I have an extra filter so there is always a dry clean one ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Cypress

customer_reviews.title: Made horribly.
customer_reviews.text: I am so angry! This is the 2nd one I have purchased in a matter of a few months and day 6 it breaks in the EXACT same spot as the last one! It tipped over and the latch that connects the two parts broke off! I used to have the old model of this vacuum and I absolutely loved it but this faulty, terribly made latch is what’s killing this vacuum. It works great otherwise but really!? Ugh!!! I am mad I didn’t save the box so I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Lynn

customer_reviews.title: pieces break off
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE on previous 5 star review: i thought it was a great buy for $25 but the handle kept falling off even though we were careful with it; we duct taped it on... then the plastic lever broke when cleaning the filter for the second time... so we duct taped it on- still works but my previous review was 5 stars- as long as all the duct tape works i’ll give it 3 stars overall for practicality
customer_reviews.author: Monica Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money! Only lasted a month!
customer_reviews.text: My return window closed September 10, 2020 and today I went to use it and the entire front end broke off because the clip completely broke off. It is not repairable so $26 went right in the trash. I purchased a simar model from big lots and was able to get 2 years out of it (and it only cost $15) main use was to simply vaccum the hardwood portion of the home. Horre quality. Save your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Why are you even reading the reviews on an $19 vacuum? It's not like you were actually considering that $500 Dyson that won't even fit in your tiny apartment's only closet. It's cheap, it's ugly, and it's not powerful. But it works. I put it together while drunk and I won't be mad if it breaks. You're probably like me, so just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: AO

customer_reviews.title: Hard-Working Little Sucker
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. I've had mine for months. We live in what used to be a hotel room (with no hotel service). The room has wall-to-wall low-pile carpeting that sees a steady fall of crumbs, messes from meal preparation, soil from my indoor gardening, bits and grits from creative projects. Ceramic floor in bathroom gets hair from grooming as well as DIY haircuts. This vacuum cleaner handles all of these messes very well. My child and I use it frequently. It is easy to handle, take apart, clean and re-assemble. With no beater brush, it may not be suitable for plush carpets, but it cleans our place with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sand

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product, but I didn't. If you want an inexpensive way to clean items from a carpet, they sell unpowered rolling carpet cleaners. Otherwise I'd just save up for a better vacuum. Suction was non-existent, and cleaning it when it did suck it was ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cheap Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for years, and it still works pretty well. The sound it makes is higher in pitch than it once was, but otherwise is still perfectly functional. If you're using it for a lot of hair and/or dust, it sometimes gets partially clogged and requires that you manually pull some out to free it up again, but is still a great vacuum for the price.
customer_reviews.author: meethster

customer_reviews.title: This little electric broom is awesome, I just whip this out when I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This little electric broom is awesome, I just whip this out when I have just light sweeping to do inside the bathroom, kitchen or even on the carpeted floors. If you're looking for something to do major cleaning then I suggest that you invest in a regular size vacuum cleaner as this is not it, this is for whenever you don't want to bring out the big boy when you just want to do a little sweeping. I even used it to dust down the ceiling fans, I love my little helper saves my back whenever I used a regular broom and have to bend down to sweep it up in the dust pan.
customer_reviews.author: Mazie R

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as old version.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the old version for $20 two years ago. I wanted another one of those so I would have two. This new version is totally different, the handle is hard to grasp, the filter is completely different, etc. I didn’t even plug it in — returned. Really bummed bc the old version now sells for $45. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Mariott

customer_reviews.title: Then the motor started making a crazy sound like it was over-exerting itself and the vacuum started to ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it about 10 times in my studio apartment and thought that it got the job done. Then the motor started making a crazy sound like it was over-exerting itself and the vacuum started to get louder and louder. Now every time I turn it on it makes a horrible sound like it is self-destructing. It's really disappointing that this vacuum was designed to last for such a short life, and is built so poorly. I have had it for less than a month. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great for RVs
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for use in our RV. It is lightweight, and very thin so fits in our tall narrow closet perfectly. We purchased this because space is at a premium in our RV, and we wanted something fairly versatile. The "dust buster" portion detaches and can be used on furniture. The plastic is a little on the cheap side, but it works very well for what we use it for. I wouldn't use this product if I was doing a deep cleaning of our RV (I'd drag my dyson into the RV if we had to do that). But for use on the road during our travels - it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Changes In Latitude

customer_reviews.title: Stick Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Best part about this vacuum is the handheld element because it plugs in! No worrying about the battery running low or dying. The stick is adequate for no nap rugs but I wouldn't use it for large areas. Overall great for the kitchen. Price was right, can't beat it. No
customer_reviews.author: Gayla Allen

customer_reviews.title: DustBuster on a stick...  Not a primary vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Like that it has a crevice tool. Smells like dirt when it's full. I use for hard wood floors & a little on carpeting. Good deal. I would not use as my primary vacuum cleaner like the top reviewer has stated he has. Good for quick clean up of kitchen floor, crumbs, etc. Kinda time consuming unwrapping & wrapping cord for a quick clean up. I should have gotten a cordless one. But I can deal with this one for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you have carpet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an alternative in between moving since my other Dirt Devil stopped working, after 6 years. This "vacuum" barely picks up hair off of the floor and other debris. Pay another $15-25 to get a real vacuum. It also feels very cheap. It seems to work better on flat rugs, ironically, but not on hardwood floors or tile. I regret not spending a few more bucks to purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia M.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily!
customer_reviews.text: DON'T buy this!! It tipped over very lightly and the snap to hold the filter and tank on the the end broke. Amazon sent a replacement that was a used one and it just happened to be broke and actually missing the same exact part! Don't waste your time. I dislike the vacuum when I used it the one time before it broke but it's not built well.
customer_reviews.author: COVINCE

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Workhorse Sweeper
customer_reviews.text: Bought a “like new” item to save a few dollars. Had to return because previous purchaser did not follow Step #1 instructions - red plastic handle pieces got snapped together but the black handle was not inserted between the two red pieces - impossible to unsnap - hopefully this particular boxed sweeper will NOT be resold - it cannot be assembled. HOWEVER, I love this little workhorse & have already reordered a full priced NEW sweeper. *** Have received the NEW sweeper and Assembly was a snap. Love love love this item.
customer_reviews.author: CA Nana

customer_reviews.title: Its a classic vacuum that is still holding up on its own to the others
customer_reviews.text: Great product for me to use around the house to vacuum the wooden floors. It is light and very maneuverable that i do not have to worry about scratching the floors. Only thing i wish it had was a little more suction power, but hey for the price point that is selling at you can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: james

product_meta.title: Dirt Devil SD20000RED Simpli-Stik Vacuum Cleaner, 3-in-1 Hand and Stick Vac, Small, Lightweight and Bagless, Red
product_meta.description: Style:Simpli-Stik OnlyDesigned for the way you live! This innovative stick vacuum is perfect for rugs and hard floors, and it features an easy lift off hand vac. Just detach the hand vacuum and you are ready for dust, dirt and crumbs on furniture, counters, shelves, upholstery and drapes. An on-board crevice tools allows you to reach tight spaces in corners, around furniture and along the edges of delicate electronics. Assembled Unit Height 42.91 Inches.
feature_bullets: 3-in-1: Simpli-Stik’s easily transforms to whatever you need: a stick vac, a hand vac, or an extended hand vac; Dirt cup capacity: 0.35 liters
Easy to use: Take the chore out of cleaning with this lightweight, ready-when-you-are bagless stick vacuum cleaner – Even from right out of the box
Lightweight and powerful: Tidy up your hard floors and rugs with powerful straight suction. Tackle tight, hard to reach places with the hand vac + on-board crevice tool combo
Great for small spaces: The light, compact, and versatile vacuum design makes this great for dorms, apartments, and small spaces to store, use, and clean up easily
Rinsable filter: Keep your vacuum running stronger for longer with the easily accessed filter. Be sure to let the filter dry at least 24 hours before its next use

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars19,181 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: 16-Ft Cord, Dirt Devil Red Simpli-Stik Lightweight Corded Bagless Stick Vacuum, Dry Nozzle Brush Type - Hard Floor Straight Suction, On-Board Tools
